intro: Pachyanthus cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
